title: It's a Long Road to Heaven

tokens.lyric: It's a long road to Heaven,
But when you walk with love
With the wind on your wing
I walked, one morning by the sea

lines.raw: [G]I walked, one morning by the sea

tokens.lyric: And all the waves reached out to me

lines.raw: [C]And all the waves reached out to me

tokens.lyric: I took their tears, then let them be.

lines.raw: [Em]I took their tears, then let them be.

tokens.lyric: I walked, one morning at the dawn

lines.raw: [A]I walked, one morning at the dawn

tokens.lyric: When bits of night still lingered on

lines.raw: [D7]When bits of night still lingered on

tokens.lyric: I sought my star, but it was gone

lines.raw: [G]I sought my star, but it was gone

tokens.lyric: I walked, one morning with a friend

lines.raw: [C]I walked, one morning with a friend

tokens.lyric: And prayed the day would never end

lines.raw: [G]And prayed the day would never end

tokens.lyric: The years have flown, so why pretend

lines.raw: [Em]The years have flown, so why pretend

tokens.lyric: I walked, one morning with my King

lines.raw: [A]I walked, one morning with my King

tokens.lyric: And all my winters turned to spring

lines.raw: [D]And all my winters turned to spring

tokens.lyric: Yet every moment, held it's sting

source:
{title: It's a Long Road to Heaven}
{key: G}
{reviewed: false}

{section: Chorus}
[G]It's a long road to Heaven,
[C]A winding steep and high,
[G]But when you walk with love
[D]With the wind on your wing
[G]And cover the earth
[D]With the songs you sing
[C]The miles fly by.

{section: Verse 1}
[G]I walked, one morning by the sea
[C]And all the waves reached out to me
[Em]I took their tears, then let them be.

{{section: Verse 2}
[A]I walked, one morning at the dawn
[D7]When bits of night still lingered on
[G]I sought my star, but it was gone

{{section: Verse 3}
[C]I walked, one morning with a friend
[G]And prayed the day would never end
[Em]The years have flown, so why pretend

{{section: Verse 4}
[A]I walked, one morning with my King
[D]And all my winters turned to spring
[G]Yet every moment, held it's sting
